result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Bobby R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
2.  Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
3.  No Contact with Michael T.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
4.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

timeConds.notes: Huber.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.

11:16 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jeanne Zamzow.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Zamzow - has not received the video and has an offer to resolve the matter, will plea to count 1 as charge and count 2 amended to endangering safety by use of a dangerous weapon 941.20(1)(a) and count 3.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 3 and amended count 2.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today on counts 2 & 3.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Statement by the victim's (MT) mother.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Zamzow.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 - Court orders the judgment of conviction be withheld on count 1 and adjourns matter pending compliance with the Plea Diversion Agreement - 2 years.  

COUNTS 2 & 3:

Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

CONDITIONS (Both counts):

Court costs
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is not to be on any premises that is licensed to sell alcohol by-the-drink.
No Contact with Michael T. (Forms)
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.

Count 2 - restitution of $1100.00
Count 2 - 30 days county jail, to commence within 60 days with huber

Court orders the cash bond on file be applied first to the restitution then the court costs.

Statement by the Clerk regarding bond.  Statement by DA - requests the court modify bond to a signature bond with the same conditions.  Court orders bond modified to $1,000.00 signature bond and same conditions.

Court adjourned at 11:40 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

9:26 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present with Attorney Jeanne Zamzow.

Statement by Attorney Zamzow - still needs to review some discovery - requests an additional sixty days.

Court directs case be set for Plea/Sentencing to be held in approximately sixty days - Attorney Zamzow to advise if proceeding with that hearing or not.

Court adjourned at 9:27 a.m.
Summary of Restitution w/attachments - $1,100.00

Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court finds probable cause.  Spec Pros makes bond recommendation.
